Package com.hcyic1.brickdestroy.leaderboards

Class Leaderboards

java.lang.Object
com.hcyic1.brickdestroy.leaderboards.Leaderboards
public class Leaderboards extends Object
This is a collection of the Score object that has methods to sort, access and save high scores to a persistent file.

    Leaderboards()
    Automatically initialises and loads the high score file saved.
    Leaderboards(int mode)
    The constructor that is used for testing which does not load or initialise any leaderboards file.

      public static final int DO_NOT_LOAD_FILE
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Leaderboards

      public Leaderboards()
      Automatically initialises and loads the high score file saved. Will create one if none exists.

    • Leaderboards

      public Leaderboards(int mode)
      The constructor that is used for testing which does not load or initialise any leaderboards file.
      Parameters:
      mode - the DO_NOT_LOAD_FILE flag

  • Method Details

    • initFile

      public void initFile()
      Reads the leaderboard file or creates one if it does not exist.

    • loadHighScoresFromFile

      public void loadHighScoresFromFile()
      Once the leaderboards file is pointed to, this method will read each score line by line and append it to the list of scores in memory.

    • loadScoreFromString

      public void loadScoreFromString(String scoreString)
      Converts a single line of scores into a Score object and adds it to the leaderboards.
      Parameters:
      scoreString - comma-delimited string to be converted into a score.

    • saveHighScoresToFile

      public void saveHighScoresToFile()
      Writes the leaderboards list that is in memory into the leaderboards file for persistence.

    • addOrUpdateScore

      public void addOrUpdateScore(Score score)
      Holds the logic behind whether to add a score into the leaderboards or not. Will check existing scores to see if they are lower than the new incoming one for the current user, and sorts from best to worst score.
      Parameters:
      score - score to be added.

    • getHighScoreByName

      public Score getHighScoreByName(String name)
      Returns the score in the leaderboards list that matches the input name.
      Parameters:
      name - name string
      Returns:
      ranking of user, else -1 if not found.

    • getHighScores

      public ArrayList<Score> getHighScores()
      Returns:
      the full list of scores as an ArrayList
